DOC.brief_summary: The study evaluates the efficacy and safety of using ketorolac as a nasal spray for the acute treatment of migraine.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Intranasal Ketorolac for the Acute Treatment of Migraine
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluates the efficacy and safety of using ketorolac as a nasal spray for the acute treatment of migraine.
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of migraine with or without aura (IHS criteria 1.1 and 1.2.1); Onset of migraine prior to age 50; 28 moderate to severe migraine headaches per month Subjects receiving any investigational drug within 30 days before study entry; More than 15 headache days per month; Known allergy or hypersensitivity to ketorolac and/or excipients; Allergy to aspirin or other NSAIDs; Currently receiving other NSAIDs or aspirin; Medical history that would preclude NSAID use
